meanings.def: a product or service that is brought into one country from another
examples: import from… food imports from abroad
import into/to… cheap imports into the United States
America has cut its oil imports from the Middle East by 73%.
Imports were valued at £516 million last month.
Special duties were imposed on imports into the republic.
The value of annual imports rose rapidly.

meanings.def: the act of bringing a product or service into one country from another
examples: The report calls for a ban on the import of hazardous waste.
imports of oil
import duties/tariffs
import controls/restrictions/quotas
an import licence
A restricted import quota was set for meat products.
the UK's net imports of food
Most of their oil revenues are used to finance imports of consumer and capital goods.
matters of great import

meanings.def: the meaning of something, especially when it is not immediately clear
examples: It is difficult to understand the full import of this statement.

meanings.def: to bring a product, a service, an idea, etc. into one country from another
examples: import something The country has to import most of its raw materials.
import something from… customs imported from the West
import something into/to… the cost of importing petroleum products into the country
import something (from…) (into/to…) goods imported from Japan into the US
The store's croissants are imported directly from France.
These dogs are illegally imported into the country.

meanings.def: to get data from another program, changing its form so that the program you are using can read it
